result.execSummary:
The defendant Betty Sue Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
With credit for 40 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Betty Sue Gordon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: *Clerk did not enter due date for costs.  DUE DATE IS 01-20-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a CIVIL JUDGMENT WITH TAX INTERCEPT.  sdg

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  MICHELLE B.

Defendant sentenced to serve FORTY (40) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FORTY (40) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State has not contacted the Victim.  State moves to adjourn the matter in order to provide Victim notification.  Defense does not object.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has located a residence.  Court MODIFIES Bail to turnover to JusticePoint for placement; upon placement, Bail to revert to $250.00 PR Bond.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.

Court goes off the Record to confer with Counsel in chambers.  Hearing continues on the Record.  Court orders case adjourned to 10-28-2015 at 10:00am for Review of placement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon not in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

Defendant has not been placed in treatment yet.  Matter is adjourned to 10-27-2015 at 1:30pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report dated 10-19-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Matter in Court to address JusticePoint violation.  Court admonishes Defendant for the violation.  Defense reports that UCC will not accept the Defendant due to this particular violation.  Court MODIFIES Bail to Turnover to JusticePoint for placement into a residential facility, upon release bail to revert to the $250.00 Signature Bond.  Matter remains calendared fo review 10-20-2015 at 01:30pm.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is currently in treatment.   Defendant does not appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress, received and filed. sdg

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court, defendant Betty Sue Gordon not in court, in custody.  Brad Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Case was staffed.  Discussions as to treatment.  Case adjourned for review hearing to Br 33.  Review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Turnover to JusticePoint for placement.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
In-chambers discussion placed on the record.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Then revert to $250 PR bond  with turnover to JusticePoint for placement.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 33.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Bench warrant served; original in file.  Case set for return on bench warrant on 8-28-2015, 8:30 a.m. in Branch 22 for Branch 33.  Parties notified.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense request a brief adjournment to try and get client re-engaged with JusticePoint and enter the DPA.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michelle B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Betty Sue Gordon in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Brostom, Branch 06.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 06.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer on behalf of attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 4/27/15 @ 1:30pm
